2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.1: Now these are David's last words. David the son of Isai said: The man to whom it was appointed concerning the Christ of the God of Jacob, the excellent psalmist of Israel said:
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.2: The spirit of the Lord hath spoken by me and his word by my tongue.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.3: The God of Israel said to me, the strong one of Israel spoke, the ruler of men, the just ruler in the fear of God.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.4: <u>As the light</u>of the morning, when the sun riseth, shineth in the morning without clouds, and as the grass springeth out of the earth by rain.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.5: <u>Neither is my house</u>so great with God, that he should make with me an eternal covenant, firm in all things and assured. For he is all my salvation, and all my will: neither is there ought thereof that springeth not up.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.6: But transgressors shall all of them be plucked up as thorns: which are not taken away with hands.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.7: And if a man will touch them, he must be armed with iron and with the staff of a lance: but they shall be set on fire and burnt to nothing.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.8: These are the names of the valiant men of David.<u>Jesbaham</u>sitting in the chair was the wisest chief among the three, he was like the<u>most tender</u>little worm of the wood, who killed eight hundred men at one onset.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.9: After him was Eleazar the son of<u>Dodo</u>the Ahohite, one of the three valiant men that were with David when they defied the Philistines, and they were there gathered together to battle.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.10: And when the men of Israel were gone away, he stood and smote the Philistines till his hand was weary, and grew stiff with the sword: and the Lord wrought a great victory that day: and the people that were fled away, returned to take spoils of them that were slain.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.11: And after him was Semma the son of Age of Arari. And the Philistines were gathered together in a troop: for there was a field full of lentils. And when the people were fled from the face of the Philistines,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.12: He stood in the midst of the field, and defended it, and defeated the Philistines: and the Lord gave a great victory.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.13: Moreover also before this the three who were princes among the thirty, went down and came to David in the harvest time into the cave of Odollam: and the camp of the Philistines was in the valley of the giants.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.14: And David was then in a hold. and there was a garrison of the Philistines then in Bethlehem.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.15: And David longed, and said: O that some man would get me a drink of the water out of the cistern, that is in Bethlehem, by the gate.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.16: And the three valiant men broke through the camp of the Philistines, and drew water out of the cistern of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and brought it to David: but he would not drink, but offered it to the Lord,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.17: Saying: The Lord be merciful to me, that I may not do this: shall I drink the blood of these men that went, and the peril of their lives? therefore he would not drink. These things did these three mighty men.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.18: Abisai also the brother of Joab, the son of Sarvia, was chief among three: and he lifted up his spear against three hundred whom he slew, and he was renowned among the three,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.19: And the noblest of three, and was their chief, but to the three first he attained not.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.20: And Banaias the son of Joiada a most valiant man, of great deeds, of Cabseel: he slew the two lions of Moab, and he went down, and slew a lion in the midst of a pit, in the time of snow.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.21: He also slew an Egyptian, a man worthy to be a sight, having a spear in his hand: but he went down to him with a rod, and forced the spear out of the hand of the Egyptian, and slew him with his own spear.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.22: These things did Banaias the son of Joiada.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.23: And he was renowned among the three valiant men, who were the most honourable among the thirty: but he attained riot to the first three: and David made him of his privy council.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.24: Asael the brother of Joab was one of the thirty, Elehanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem.
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.25: Semma of Harodi, Elica of Harodi,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.26: Heles of Phalti, Hira the son of Acces of Thecua,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.27: Abiezer of Anathoth, Mobonnai of Husati,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.28: Selmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.29: Heled the son of Baana, also a Netophathite, Ithai the son of Ribai of Gabaath of the children of Benjamin,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.30: Banaia the Pharathonite, Heddai of the torrent Gaas,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.31: Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth of Beromi,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.32: Eliaba of Salaboni. The sons of Jassen, Jonathan,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.33: Semma of Orori, Aliam the son of Sarar the Arorite,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.34: Eliphelet the son of Aasbai the son of Machati, Eliam the son of Achitophel the Gelonite,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.35: Hesrai of Carmel, Pharai of Arbi,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.36: Igaal the son of Nathan of Soba, Bonni of Gadi,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.37: Selec of Ammoni, Naharai the Berothite, armourbearer of Joab the son of Sarvia,
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.38: Ira the Jethrite, Gareb also a Jethrite;
2 Samuel or 2 Kings__23.39: Urias the Hethite, thirty and seven in all.
